name: Python
description: A versatile, high-level language known for its readability and extensive libraries, widely used in web development, data science, and AI.

name: C
description: A foundational, low-level language offering fine-grained control over hardware, commonly used in operating systems and embedded systems.

name: Java
description: A robust, platform-independent language with a strong emphasis on object-oriented programming, popular in enterprise applications.

name: JavaScript
description: A dynamic scripting language primarily used for client-side web development, now also popular in server-side applications.

name: Rust
description: A systems programming language focused on safety and performance, especially memory safety without a garbage collector.

name: R
description: A language designed for statistical computing and graphics, widely used in data analysis and research.

name: PHP
description: A server-side scripting language tailored for web development, known for its simplicity and wide adoption.

name: Go
description: A statically typed, compiled language designed for simplicity, concurrency, and performance, created by Google.

name: Swift
description: A powerful, intuitive language developed by Apple for iOS and macOS apps, emphasizing safety and performance.

name: Kotlin
description: A modern, concise language interoperable with Java, widely used for Android development and beyond.

name: C++
description: An extension of C with object-oriented features, known for high performance in systems programming and game development.

name: Ruby
description: A dynamic, object-oriented language focused on simplicity and productivity, popular in web frameworks like Ruby on Rails.

name: Perl
description: A flexible, text-processing language known for its powerful regular expressions and scripting capabilities.

name: Haskell
description: A purely functional language with strong static typing, favored for its mathematical precision and academic use.

name: Lua
description: A lightweight, embeddable scripting language designed for simplicity and performance in games and applications.

name: Scala
description: A hybrid language combining object-oriented and functional programming, built on the JVM for enterprise use.

name: TypeScript
description: A superset of JavaScript adding static types, enhancing scalability and maintainability in web development.

name: Dart
description: A client-optimized language by Google, used primarily for building mobile and web apps with Flutter.

name: Elixir
description: A dynamic, functional language built on the Erlang VM, designed for scalable and fault-tolerant applications.

name: MATLAB
description: A numerical computing environment and language used extensively in engineering, science, and mathematics.

name: C#
description: A modern, object-oriented language by Microsoft, widely used in game development (Unity) and enterprise software.

name: Objective-C
description: An object-oriented extension of C, foundational for early iOS and macOS development before Swift.

name: Pascal
description: A structured, educational language designed for teaching programming concepts and clarity.

name: Fortran
description: One of the oldest languages, optimized for numerical and scientific computing, still used in high-performance applications.

name: Ada
description: A structured, statically typed language designed for safety and reliability in critical systems like aerospace.

name: Groovy
description: A dynamic language for the JVM, enhancing Java with scripting capabilities and concise syntax.

name: Erlang
description: A language optimized for concurrency, reliability, and telecom systems, powering scalable applications.

name: Clojure
description: A modern Lisp dialect for the JVM, emphasizing functional programming and immutable data.

name: F#
description: A functional-first language on .NET, blending static typing with concise syntax for data-driven applications.

name: Scheme
description: A minimalist Lisp dialect used in education to teach functional programming concepts.

name: V
description: A simple, fast, and safe language designed for maintainable software with minimal abstraction.

name: D
description: A multi-paradigm language aiming to improve on C++ with better safety and productivity features.

name: Crystal
description: A Ruby-inspired language with static typing and native compilation for performance.

name: Julia
description: A high-performance language for technical computing, blending dynamic typing with speed.

name: Nim
description: A statically typed, compiled language with Python-like syntax, targeting performance and flexibility.

name: Zig
description: A simple, low-level language focused on safety and control, competing with C without a garbage collector.

name: OCaml
description: A functional language with strong static typing, used in academia and high-performance applications.

name: Racket
description: A Lisp dialect designed for education and scripting, with a focus on language experimentation.

name: Elm
description: A functional language for reliable web frontends, compiling to JavaScript with a focus on simplicity.

name: COBOL
description: A verbose, business-oriented language still used in legacy financial and enterprise systems.

name: Prolog
description: A logic programming language used in AI and computational linguistics, based on formal reasoning.

name: Smalltalk
description: A pioneering object-oriented language that influenced modern programming paradigms.

name: Lisp
description: One of the oldest languages, foundational for AI research with its focus on symbolic computation.

name: Bash
description: A Unix shell scripting language for automating tasks and system administration.

name: PowerShell
description: A task automation and configuration management framework from Microsoft, built on .NET.

name: Assembly
description: A low-level language specific to hardware architectures, offering maximum control and efficiency.

name: Tcl
description: A simple, embeddable scripting language known for its use in GUIs and automation.

name: Haxe
description: A cross-platform language that compiles to multiple targets, popular in game development.

name: Forth
description: A stack-based language known for its simplicity and use in embedded systems.

name: APL
description: A concise, array-oriented language for mathematical and data analysis tasks.

name: ABAP
description: A language developed by SAP for building business applications, tightly integrated with SAP systems.

name: ActionScript
description: A scripting language for Adobe Flash, used for rich internet applications and animations.

name: ALGOL 68
description: An influential successor to ALGOL 60, known for its structured programming features.

name: Apex
description: A Java-like language for Salesforce, used for custom business logic in the cloud.

name: Awk
description: A text-processing language designed for data extraction and reporting, common in Unix.

name: Ballerina
description: A cloud-native language for microservices and networked applications with built-in concurrency.

name: BCPL
description: A precursor to C, influential in early systems programming and language design.

name: ColdFusion
description: A scripting language for rapid web application development, now owned by Adobe.

name: Delphi
description: An evolution of Pascal for rapid application development, popular for Windows software.

name: Eiffel
description: A language emphasizing design-by-contract and reliability in object-oriented systems.

name: Elm
description: A functional language for reliable web frontends, compiling to JavaScript.

name: Factor
description: A stack-oriented language inspired by Forth, with modern features and libraries.

name: Falcon
description: A multi-paradigm scripting language designed for flexibility and embedding.

name: Hack
description: A PHP dialect by Facebook with static typing for large-scale web applications.

name: Icon
description: A language with goal-directed execution, influential in string processing.

name: Io
description: A minimalist, prototype-based language inspired by Smalltalk and Lua.

name: J
description: A successor to APL, focused on array programming and concise syntax.

name: JCL
description: A scripting language for IBM mainframes to control job execution.

name: JScript
description: Microsoft’s dialect of ECMAScript, used in Internet Explorer for web scripting.

name: LabVIEW
description: A graphical language for engineering and data acquisition systems.

name: Ladder Logic
description: A graphical language for programming PLCs in industrial automation.

name: Logo
description: An educational language for teaching programming via turtle graphics.

name: Modula-2
description: A structured language by Niklaus Wirth, improving on Pascal for systems programming.

name: MQL4
description: A language for programming trading strategies in MetaTrader 4.

name: Oberon
description: A minimalist language by Niklaus Wirth for system programming and education.

name: OpenCL
description: A framework and language for parallel computing across CPUs and GPUs.

name: PostScript
description: A page description language by Adobe, foundational for printing and graphics.

name: PureScript
description: A strongly-typed functional language compiling to JavaScript for web development.

name: QBasic
description: A beginner-friendly BASIC dialect by Microsoft for early programming education.

name: Raku
description: A successor to Perl 6, blending multiple paradigms with a focus on expressiveness.

name: Reason
description: A syntax-friendly variant of OCaml for JavaScript and native development.

name: Rexx
description: A human-readable scripting language for IBM mainframes and automation.

name: SAS
description: A language for statistical analysis and data mining, widely used in business.

name: Simula
description: The first object-oriented language, influential in simulation and education.

name: Solidity
description: A language for smart contracts on Ethereum, focused on blockchain development.

name: SQL
description: A standard language for managing and querying relational databases.

name: Squirrel
description: A lightweight scripting language for games and embedded systems.

name: Standard ML
description: A functional language with strong typing, influential in academia and compilers.

name: Turing
description: A Pascal-like language designed for teaching programming concepts.

name: Vala
description: A language for GNOME applications, compiling to C with modern syntax.

name: Verilog
description: A hardware description language for designing and simulating digital circuits.

name: VHDL
description: A language for describing and simulating electronic systems and hardware.

name: Visual Basic
description: A beginner-friendly language by Microsoft for rapid Windows application development.

name: WebAssembly
description: A low-level language for high-performance web applications in browsers.

name: Wolfram
description: The language of Mathematica, used for symbolic computation and data analysis.

name: Xtend
description: A modern JVM language with concise syntax, interoperable with Java.

name: Lobster
description: A statically typed language with Python-esque syntax, designed for games and graphics, featuring compile-time reference counting and a terse, refactor-friendly design.

name: Agda
description: A dependently typed functional language used for theorem proving and formal verification, with a focus on mathematical precision and research.

name: Rocq
description: An interactive theorem prover and dependently typed functional language for formal verification, mathematical proofs, and certified programming, based on the Calculus of Inductive Constructions.

name: Dafny
description: A language with built-in specification constructs for formal verification, enabling proofs of program correctness using an SMT solver.

name: Frama-C
description: A framework for analyzing C code with ACSL, a specification language for formal verification, used in safety-critical systems and research.

name: Gambas
description: An object-oriented BASIC dialect with an IDE, designed for Linux, offering a Visual Basic-like experience with support for GUI development, databases, and scripting.

name: Lean
description: An interactive theorem prover and dependently typed functional language for formalizing mathematics and verifying software correctness.

name: Maple
description: A symbolic and numeric computation language within the Maple CAS, designed for advanced mathematics, engineering, and educational applications.

name: Odin
description: A modern, statically typed language designed as a C alternative, emphasizing simplicity, performance, and explicit memory control for systems and game development.

name: WhyML
description: A deductive verification platform with a language for specifying and proving program correctness, integrated with external provers like Z3 and Coq.
